field.label: SEEK Description
field.description:
We are currently seeking the services of an experienced Chef Manager to manage the kitchen and functions at our clients busy rehabilitation hospital based in Curl Curl, Sydney Northern Beaches.

Roster:

Monday to Friday- 9.00am to 5.30pm

Key Attributes:

• Qualified chef
• Excellent communication skills and ability to lead a team
• Kitchen management experience
• Have a strong understanding of HACCP and Food Safety Legislation
• Thorough understanding of OH&S and Food Safety practices

Responsibilities of the position:

• Providing meals for patients and staff
• Staff management and rostering
• Monitoring and promoting kitchen hygiene and safety practices
• Overall operation of kitchen including production of meals as per approved menus
• High attention to detail with a hands on approach
• Innovative food and marketing of theme days and special events
• Ability to multi task and work in a fast paced, dynamic environment

Benefits of the position:

• Uniform supplied
• On the job training and further training opportunities
• Fast growing company

About the Company:

Cater Care Australia specialises in providing catering services to sectors such as:
• Retail – Coffee Shops
• Health & Juice Bars
• Business and Industry – Industrial Canteens
• Healthcare – Nursing Homes, Retirement Villages
• Education – Private Schools, Universities and TAFE Colleges

Our core values of Care, Pride and Community are values that our people own and believe in and demonstrate throughout all aspects of our business on a daily basis. We value the importance of developing a career with Cater Care and not “just a job”.

Applicants will be required to undertake a police check upon commencement of employment.

If you feel you are the right candidate to join our team, please forward your resume to bryce@catercareaustralia.com.au

field.label: Introduction
field.description: We are currently seeking the services of an experienced Chef Manager to manage the kitchen and functions at our clients busy rehabilitation hospital.

field.label: SEEK Description
field.description:
At Cater Care Services, we specialise in providing facility support services to the Mining, Construction, Off-Shore and Defence Industries through Australia and Overseas. Our core values of Care, Pride and Community are values that our people own and believe in and demonstrate throughout all aspects of our business on a daily basis.

Due to continued expansion into the WA market, we are now seeking the services of an experienced and self motivated Administrative Assistant to help assist in site mobilisation activities and other associated administration.

This position will be based in our new Stirling office which is extremely close to public transport and other amentities.

The role duties:

  1. Assist in the compliance with site specific forms and requirements to mobilise new employees to site
  2. Booking and administration of pre/employment medicals
  3. Liaising with candidates, phone call/emails
  4. Attending to visitors/applicants for interviews via reception
  5. Reception Coverage if required
  6. Arrange & Schedule flights

Requirements:

  1. Ability to utilise Microsoft Office programs
  2. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  3. Time management skills
  4. Strong customer service focus
  5. Preferred candidates will have Admin experience within the mining industry

To apply for this position please send your resume to hradminwa@catercareservices.com.au

field.label: SEEK Description
field.description:

Key attributes:

  • Chef/Trade Qualifications
  • Experienced in remote catering
  • Kitchen management, experience in budgets, rosters and food costs
  • Thourough understanding of OH&S and food safety practices

Responsibilties:

  • Monitoring and promoting kitchen hygiene and safety practices
  • Overall operation of kitchen including production of meals as per approved menus

If you feel you are the right person to join our team please forward your resume to hradminwa@catercarerservices.com.au

field.label: Introduction
field.description: Cater Care Services provides faclilty support services to mining, construction, off shore and defence industries through Australia and Overseas.

field.label: SEEK Description
field.description:
Primary Purpose:

To manage and provide support in the areas of safety, health and environment for your designated region of responsibility.

  • Establish a strong link with the CCS our Client’s OHS & Environment Management teams to ensure full compliance with CCS & Client SHE policies, systems and procedures.
  • Provide accurate and strategic KPI reporting and analysis for the Client and Cater Care business to ensure we are well informed and are able to track the company’s progress
  • Participate in the review process & provide technical support and advice for all SHE strategies as requested
  • Ensure all risk control strategies from the ‘Safe Work Procedures’ and, ‘Task Based Risk Assessments’ are reviewed and implemented on all sites.
  • Provide technical support and advice on legislative and Company requirements
  • Undertake continuous improvement activities, auditing and coaching at sites
  • Ensure all accreditation activities are achieved within budget and time frame
  • Maintain database records and generate accurate reporting data
  • Maintain established computerised SHE record management system, including registers and databases.
  • Follow standard procedures using existing models / fields of information
  • Work with Sites to ensure compliance to SHE compliance requirements
  • Liaison with your Manager to whom you will advise of all problems

The duties listed above are your key tasks, however, there will be other tasks and changes that are inevitable and not listed due to the service nature of our business and your co-operation is expected at all times.

Job Role – Essential/Desirable Criteria:

  • Computer program experience: Excel – Word - Outlook
  • HACCP working knowledge
  • Cert IV Safety
  • Cert IV Training & Assessment
  • OH&S working knowledge & Certification
  • Environmental working knowledge
  • Database experience – Record keeping
  • Demonstrated experience with key components of the role
  • Previous experience working within a Contract catering SHE environment (desirable)

Behavioural Competencies:

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Flexibility – ability to adapt to busy/changing conditions
  • Teamwork
  • Strong customer service focus
  • Accountability
  • Facilitation and presentation skills

 Duties

  1. ROI (Register Of Incidents) Review Corrective Actions
  2. Hazard Register – Enter details from off the Hazard/Near Miss Reports
    Review Corrective Actions
  3. Monthly Audit Compliance
    Enter received reports into the ‘Monthly Audit Compliance Register’
    Liaise with Site Managers to ensure all requirements are met
  4. Enter ‘Site Services & Waste Management Form’ data into Site Registers
  5. Review & produce SHE Documents as requested
  6. Complete all Client SHE documentation requirements, using their reporting procedures.

Site Task Duties

  1. Complete the ‘Site Inspection and Audit Report Summary’
  2. Close out as many corrective actions from the audit while on site
  3. Deliver a toolbox to all staff – as per the toolbox calendar and items as relevant to the site
  4. Complete and sign off on the competency based training units
  5. Attend a Client OHS meeting each visit
  6. Ensure the training register is updated
  7. Ensure Cater Care Safety Notice boards are correct and up to date.
  8. Ensure all vehicle logs are correct and up to date.

This is a Fly In Fly Out role on a 28 days on 9 days off roster. We also offer accommodation and meals on site, 4 weeks annual leave and the opportunity for continuous growth and development.

At Cater Care Services, we specialises in providing facility support services to the Mining, Construction, Off-Shore and Defence Industries through Australia and Overseas. Our core values of Care, Pride and Community are values that our people own and believe in and demonstrate throughout all aspects of our business on a daily basis.

To apply for this position ple

field.label: Introduction
field.description: We are currently seeking the services of an experienced Full time Chef Manager to be based at our site in Port Augusta, South Australia. This Full time position is Monday to Friday, 8.00am to 4.30pm.

field.label: SEEK Description
field.description:
As our newly valued Chef, you will be responsible for ensuring effective operation of the food preparation, production and service requirements of the site.

We strongly encourage applicants with the following qualities to apply:

• Excellence in customer service
• Flexibility to plan residents’ catering requirements in advance
• Motivated and accountable
• Trade qualifications
• 3 years relevant industry experience
• Demonstrated experience in Safety and HACCP
• Excellent organisational skills

You would be expected to adhere to all standards as set by the Company - in return you’ll have the opportunity to utilize your strong work ethics and time management skills. Working as part of a dynamic team your expertise and assistance will be requested for maintaining schedules and service commitments.

Experience in a similar role within a camp environment would be highly regarded.

This is a Fly In/Fly Out role on a 2 week on 1 week off roster. In addition to flights from Brisbane airport, we also offer accommodation and meals on site, 4 weeks annual leave and the opportunity for continuous growth and development.

At Cater Care Services, we specialises in providing facility support services to the Mining, Construction, Off-Shore and Defence Industries through Australia and Overseas. Our core values of Care, Pride and Community are values that our people own and believe in and demonstrate throughout all aspects of our business on a daily basis.

To apply for this position please send an Application Letter together with a resume to recruit@catercareservices.com.au

The Cleaner/Kitchen Hand role will be responsible for:

• Cleaning duties to ensure cleanliness of the site in accordance with site requirements and Company standards
• Occasional assistance with Grounds – emptying bins

The successful applicant will have the following skills or experience:

• Exceptional customer service skills
• Enthusiastic, motivated and reliable
• Eye for detail
• Knowledge of the correct use of chemicals
• Ability to understand and comply with Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS)
• Knowledge of the safe and correct operation of cleaning equipment
• Food handling knowledge and skills
• Food Handler’s Certificate or be willing to obtain one

You will be a team player with a “can do” attitude who ideally will have experience with a similar role in a remote camp environment.

• Current references required at the interview
• A medical will be required

This is a Fly In/Fly Out role on a 2 week on 1 week off roster. We also offer accommodation and meals on site, 4 weeks annual leave and the opportunity for continuous growth and development.

field.label: SEEK Description
field.description: Cater Care Australia specialises in providing catering services to sectors such as Healthcare - Nursing Homes, Retirement Villages and Education - Private Schools, Business and Industry - Industrial Canteens. Our core values of Care, Pride and Community are values that our people own and believe in, and demonstrate throughout all aspects of our business, on a daily basis. • Queensland Location • Full Time • 100% Australian Owned Company We are currently seeking the services of an experienced Chef Manager to be part of our site team based in Queensland. The Chef Manager role will be responsible for: • Driving the Cater Care core values • Managing the daily requirements of your site, ensuring all service requirements are delivered in accordance with Company standards and client expectations. The successful applicant will have the following skills or experience: • A passion for excellent customer skills with the ability to be flexible and be able to plan site management requirements in advance • Motivated and accountable • 5 years relevant industry experience • Demonstrated experience in Safety and HACCP • Trade qualifications • People management experience • Business financial understanding • Ability to operate a site within budget requirements • Demonstrated experience with key components of the role your duties will include: • Developing menus, food preparation and cooking • Staff training and development • Staff management • Administration paper work • Stock control, ordering and stock takes • Cash handling, banking and reconciliation • Client Relationship Management Experience with a similar role in a contract catering environment will be highly regarded. Current references required at the interview & Police Check will be required. To apply for this position please send a resume to s.rhodes@catercareaustralia.com.au

field.label: Introduction
field.description: • 100% Australian Owned • Full Time Position • Fast Growing Company

field.label: SEEK Description
field.description:
We are currently seeking the services of experienced Catering Assistants on a Part time basis to be based at our site in Cleveland, QLD. We have several Part time positions available ranging between 20-30 hours per week over 7 days.

Responsibilities include:
• Food preparation
• Assisting in dinning room set up
• Taking of orders and serving of food and beverages
• Maintaining a clean and hygienic work environment
• Cash Register operation
• Excellent customer service skills to maintain a friendly and vibrant atmosphere

Key Attributes:
• Strong customer service philosophy
• Kitchen and food preparation experience
• Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate with a range of people from all corners of the globe
• Aged Care Facility Experience or similar
• Good understanding of HACCP and food safety practices

Benefits of the position:
• Uniform Provided
• On the job training and further training opportunities
• Very friendly team

About the Company:
Cater Care Australia specialises in providing catering services to sectors such as:
• Retail – Coffee Shops
• Health & Juice Bars
• Business and Industry – Industrial Canteens
• Healthcare – Nursing Homes, Retirement Villages
• Education – Private Schools, Universities and TAFE Colleges

Our core values of Care, Pride and Community are values that our people own and believe in and demonstrate throughout all aspects of our business on a daily basis.

If you feel you are the right candidate to join our  friendly team, please forward your resume to brisbane@catercareaustralia.com.au

field.label: Introduction
field.description: We are currently seeking the services of experienced Catering Assistants on a Part time basis to be based at our site in Cleveland, QLD.

field.label: SEEK Description
field.description:
Cater Care Services specialises in providing facility support services to the Mining, Construction, Off-Shore and Defence Industries through Australia and Overseas. We are currently seeking Expressions of Interest for the following positions for a new site in Queensland:
 
  • Site Managers
  • Chefs
  • Utilities
 
The successful applicant will have the following skills or experience:
 
  • A passion for excellent customer skills
  • Motivated and accountable
  • At least 2 years relevant industry experience
  • Demonstrated experience in Safety and HACCP
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Trade qualifications
 
For all roles, you will be required to adhere to all standards as set by the Company, and you will have strong work ethics combined with time management skills and be prepared to assist all other employee in maintaining schedules and service commitments when required.
 
Experience with a similar role in a camp environment will be highly regarded.
 
These are fly in/fly out roles on a 28 day on 9 day off roster.
 
  • Current references required at the interview
  • A medical will be required
 
To apply for this position please send an Application Letter together with a resume to nia.lloyd@catercareservices.com.au

field.label: Introduction
field.description: Cater Care Services specialises in providing facility support services to the Mining, Construction, Off-Shore and Defence Industries across Australia.

field.label: SEEK Description
field.description: Cater Care Services specialises in providing facility support services to the Mining, Construction, Off-Shore and Defence Industries through Australia and Overseas. We are currently seeking the services of an experienced Utilities - Housekeeping to be part of our site team based in Dysart. ---- The Utilities – Housekeeping role will be responsible for: ---- • Cleaning duties to ensure cleanliness of the site in accordance with site requirements and Company standards --- The successful applicant will have the following skills or experience: ---- • Exceptional customer service skills • Enthusiastic, motivated and reliable • Eye for detail • Knowledge of the correct use of chemicals • Ability to understand and comply with Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) • Knowledge of the safe and correct operation of cleaning equipment • Food handling knowledge and skills • Coal Board Generics • Coal Board Medical • White Card ---- You will be a team player with a “can do” attitude who ideally will have experience with a similar role in a remote camp environment. • Current references required at the interview • A medical will be required ---- This is a drive in/drive out role only with a 10 day on 4 day off schedule. ---- To apply for this position please send an Application Letter together with a resume to nia.lloyd@catercareservices.com.au

field.label: Introduction
field.description: Cater Care Services specialises in providing facility support services to the Mining, Construction, Off-Shore and Defence Industries

field.label: SEEK Description
field.description: Cater Care Services specialises in providing facility support services to the Mining, Construction, Off-Shore and Defence Industries through Australia and Overseas. We are currently seeking the services of Expressions of Interest for Chefs for various positions within Australia. ---- As Chef you will be responsible for ensuring effective operation of the food preparation, production and service requirements of the site. ---- The successful applicant will have the following skills or experience: ---- • A passion for excellent customer skills with the ability to be flexible and be able to plan residents’ catering requirements in advance • Motivated and accountable • Trade qualifications • 3 years relevant industry experience • Demonstrated experience in Safety and HACCP • Excellent organisational skills --- You will be required to adhere to all standards as set by the Company, and you will have strong work ethics combined with time management skills and be prepared to assist all other employee in maintaining schedules and service commitments when required. ---- Experience with a similar role in a camp environment will be highly regarded. ---- • Current references required at the interview • A medical will be required --- To apply for this position please send an Application Letter together with a resume to nia.lloyd@catercareservices.com.au

field.label: Introduction
field.description: Cater Care Services specialises in providing facility support services to the Mining, Construction, Off-Shore and Defence Industries

field.label: SEEK Description
field.description: Cater Care Services specialises in providing facility support services to the Mining, Construction, Off-Shore and Defence Industries through Australia and Overseas. --- We are currently seeking the services of self-motivated industry professionals to help implement and drive a positive safety culture within our site operations. --- We are seeking three SHE Officers to cover: • Queensland • Victoria/South Australia • Northern Territory ---The position is site based working on a 2 week on 1 week off rotation. ---The successful applicant will possess the following key skills: • Certificate IV in Occupational Health/Safety & Training & Assessment • Strong leadership skills • Strong written and verbal communication skills • HACCP and Food Safety training/experience • Current knowledge of legislative obligations relating to Occupational Safety and Health --- Responsibilities of Position: • The role is responsible for supporting the Site Project Manager and team in the safe delivery of Accommodation and Catering services. • You will be responsible for ensuring site compliance to the company and client OHS systems and procedures. • You will assist in the delivery of tool box training and in site inductions. • Your consultative skills will enable you to provide professional advice and services to line staff regarding Safety and Health practice and implementation. • You will assist in the delivery of continuous improvement, behavioural change and developing a culture conducive to performance outcomes. --- Your ability to encourage and mentor continued compliance to the company minimum standards and seek ownership from site employees is critical to the success of your role. --- Please send your current resume with an application letter to: nia.lloyd@catercareservices.com.au

field.label: Introduction
field.description: Cater Care Services specialises in providing facility support services to the Mining, Construction, Off-Shore and Defence Industries

field.label: SEEK Description
field.description: Cater Care Services specialises in providing facility support services to the Mining, Construction, Off-Shore and Defence Industries through Australia and Overseas. ---- We are currently seeking the services of a self-motivated Healthy Lifestyle Coordinator who will be responsible for the planning and development of suitable lifestyle programs to foster an environment for health and wellbeing for all staff. ---- In this role, the successful candidate will be responsible for: • Developing and implementing an innovative and individual resident focussed lifestyle program • Development of nutritional food plans in consultation with the Food and Beverage Manager • Facilitate group and individual activities based on assessed needs and preferences of residents • Development and implementation of continuous improvement activities to meet site, client and organisational goals • Responding to the changing needs of residents through the tailoring of programs to meed individual needs • Promoting opportunities for resident participation in recreational activities and lifestyle programs • Coordinate and promote community related initiatives --- We are looking for someone who has had least 2 years relevant industry experience, with a tertiary qualification (degree in Human Movement Accredited Personal Trainer, or Equivalent) ---- Previous experience in co-ordinating leisure and lifestyle programs is essential, as well as excellent communication and interpersonal skills. ---- You will have the drive and self-motivation to plan and implement creative programs which are in line with the client’s expectations and requirements. ---- Remote camp experience and OH&S training would give a distinct advantage. ---- Please send your current resume with an application letter to: nia.lloyd@catercareservices.com.au
